text: Describe how representations of equality and inequality are helpful in making sense of situations and in solving problems.

• Equalities are used when you are looking for one exact answer, and inequalities are used when you are looking for a range of possible values.
  • You can represent inequalities in algebraic form and on number lines.
  • You can solve inequalities to find an unknown number similar to how you solve equalities to find an unknown number, but you interpret the answer differently based on the type of inequality.
